item.description:
For those of us who missed it the first time...

Join us for an evening in Providence to experience Waterfire. We will meet for a nice dinner and then stroll along the waterfront enjoying the sight and sounds of this festive event. In addition to the fires, there is also a salsa dancing demonstration we can see.

Meet at 5:30 in the mall parking lot near Whole Foods. From there we will walk a short distance to the Parkside restaurant.

Please carpool to this event if you can!

I-95 south to exit 24 for Branch Ave.
Slight left at Branch Ave.
Right at N Main St (also known as RI-122S and US-1 S)
Main St is divided into 2 roads, north and south. The Mall is on the northbound side and you can make a U-turn at Olney St, which is at the south end of the mall.

Rain cancels this event.

reservations for 15 at Parkside restaurant at 6.
http://www.diningques...

www.Waterfire.org

WaterFire Providence is the award-winning sculpture by Barnaby Evans installed on the three rivers of downtown Providence, and has been praised by Rhode Island residents and international visitors alike as a powerful work of art and a moving symbol of Providence?s renaissance. WaterFire's sparkling bonfires, the fragrant scent of aromatic wood smoke, the flickering firelight on the arched bridges, the silhouettes of the firetenders passing by the flames, the torch-lit vessels traveling down the river, and the enchanting music from across the world all engage the senses and emotions of those who stroll the paths and bridges of Waterplace Park. WaterFire has captured the imagination of many thousands of people, bringing life to downtown, and continues to revitalize Rhode Island's capital city.
item.name: Waterfire in Providence, Aug 18
